messages.message:
Hi team. We want to include PR-based coverage report for the `ibformers` library - this would serve as an additional github check before merging the changes. Currently the tests run on jenkins pipeline, and in this setup we’d have to generate the report there and somehow send it to github. I’m not sure if that’s possible.

One possible solution would be to move the unittests from jenkins pipeline to github workflow, as github provides some tools to display the generated report. Is this something we can do in terms of possible costs, security etc?

cc @shiqi - when I looked for similar topics in slack search, I found discussion on testmo. Is this something related that could be applied to our repo as well?

Are you looking for code coverage or test result management? The testmo project is for the later as it doesn’t handle code coverage report

You can generate the report anywhere and then send it to github, see github checks API https://docs.github.com/en/rest/checks (https://docs.github.com/en/rest/checks)

> Are you looking for code coverage or test result management? The testmo project is for the later as it doesn’t handle code coverage report
Code coverage. I just didn’t have much context on the testmo, thanks for clarifying.

> You can generate the report anywhere and then send it to github, see github checks API https://docs.github.com/en/rest/checks
Ok, this looks like what I need. Thanks.
